intro: Lundellianthus breedlovei, commonly known as the Texas mountain lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Texas and New Mexico. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related plants, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It produces striking white or pale yellow blooms during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
